subject: Re: [junit] Re: SWT unit testing
msgSnippet: Looks interesting I will check it out.  From reading the decription if the book  it still looks like I m going to have to setup (mock?) plugins to be able to
messageBody:
Looks interesting I will check it out. From reading the decription if
the book it still looks like I'm going to have to setup (mock?)
plugins to be able to test simple SWT constructs.


On Thu, 16 Dec 2004 12:58:17 -0500, Jason Rogers
<jacaetevha@...> wrote:
> On Thursday 16 December 2004 12:39, Thomas L Roche wrote:
> > Jason Rogers Thu, 16 Dec 2004 09:26:50 -0500
> >
> > > One source to look at for testing SWT things is Kent Beck's TDD book
> >
> >
> >
> (http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0321146530/102-3564878-60257
> >13?v=glance).
> >
> > > I read it some time back, but as I recall he goes through creating
> > > the JUnit plug-in in a test-first fashion.
> >
> > Umm ... what edition? I have 4th printing (Mar 2004) and IIRC there is
> > literally nothing in there about Eclipse or SWT or any UI discussion
> > of consequence. <quick look> Nothing in the index, certainly.
> >
> > > So, he's bound to have tests in the book for SWT components.
> >
> > Alas the premise fails ...
>
> Sorry, wrong book in mind. I meant this one that Kent co-authored with
> Erich
> Gamma:
> http://www.aw-bc.com/catalog/academic/product/0,1144,0321205758,00.html
>
> --
> Jason Rogers
>
> "I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
> but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
> the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
> me, and gave himself for me."
> Galatians 2:20
